instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi. I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>. I replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> same thing. There was a moment before i did anything that it showed green light once and powered on and then it stopped. The SMC I also re-balled.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> -12.3v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> - 15.2v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.4v

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: I have replaced the SMC with another one from a different model, now I have a green light but no power and on/off triggers

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS now?
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage is correct?

Be sure to use original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS it's 0v and  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  is 12.6v. I am using the original 85w adapter

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: I ordered another SMC with exactly the same and soldered it but still same outcome green light no power <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.29v now

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
May be bad SMC, or not good soldered.
Put back original SMC.
Try to get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> again.

Check if <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> comes on.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: I had a shorted line on <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_LL</SIGNAL> and replaced <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> power on now all good :)the battery is not good and it's really slow...

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: I tried 2 different Bios files Clear ME and another but when i try to boot the installation it shows 5101f error... any idea ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Machine being slow can be caused by bad battery.
You should test with known good battery.

Did you run corresponding ASD test?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
We can close this case the new smc somehow burned i soldered back the old SMC and still the same. I advised client that also the battery is  bad, and he didn't want to proceed, just data taken out. 

Thanks :)
